edu.rit.util

Class Map<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Map<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key data type.
    V - Value data type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Combiner, IdentityMap

    public class Map<K,V>
extends Object
implements Streamable, Cloneable
    Class Map provides a mapping from keys to values. The key must be an object suitable for use in a hashed data structure; that is, the key class must define the equals() and hashCode() methods properly. Keys may be null. Once a key is stored in a map, the state of the key must not be altered. The value may be any object. Values may be null. Once a value is stored in a map, the state of the value may be altered, and the value may be replaced by a different object.

    The map calls the protected getPair() method to make a key-value mapping (pair) being added to the map. The map calls the protected copyKey() method to make a copy of a key being added to the map. The map calls the protected copyValue() method to make a copy of a value being added to the map. The default is to copy just the key and value references. This behavior can be changed by overriding the aforementioned methods in a subclass of class Map.

    Class Map is streamable. For object streaming to work properly, the key and the value classes must be streamable or serializable.

    Note: Class Map is not multiple thread safe.

      • inverseGet

        public K inverseGet(V value)
        Get the key associated with the given value in this map. If this map does not contain value, null is returned.

        The inverseGet() method performs a linear search of the key-value mappings in this map to find a mapping whose value is equal to the given value, as determined by the value class's equals() method. If more than one mapping has the given value, one such mapping is chosen in an unspecified manner, and the chosen mapping's key is returned.

        Parameters:
        value - Value, or null.
        Returns:
        Key associated with value, or null.

      • put

        public void put(K key,
       V value)
        Map the given key to the given value in this map.

        A pair containing the given key and value, created using the getPair() method, is stored in this map.

        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        value - Value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null.

      • remove

        public V remove(K key)
        Remove the given key and its associated value from this map. The value formerly associated with key is returned. If this map does not contain key, this map is not altered and null is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        Returns:
        Value associated with key, or null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null.

      • forEachItemDo

        public void forEachItemDo(Action<Pair<K,V>> action)
        Perform the given action on each key-value mapping in this map. For each mapping in this map in an unspecified order, the given action's run() method is called, passing in a pair containing the key and the value. The state of the key must not be altered. The state of the value may be altered, and the value may be replaced by a different object; such changes are reflected in this map.

        Warning: If the action adds mappings to or removes mappings from the map, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Parameters:
        action - Action.

      • forEachItemDo

        public <R> R forEachItemDo(ActionResult<Pair<K,V>,R> action)
        Perform the given action on each key-value mapping in this map and return a result. For each mapping in this map in an unspecified order, the given action's run() method is called, passing in a pair containing the key and the value. The state of the key must not be altered. The state of the value may be altered, and the value may be replaced by a different object; such changes are reflected in this map. After all the mappings have been processed, the given action's result() method is called, and its result is returned.

        Warning: If the action adds mappings to or removes mappings from the map, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Result data type.
        Parameters:
        action - Action.
        Returns:
        Result of processing all the mappings.

      • removeEachItemIf

        public void removeEachItemIf(Predicate<Pair<K,V>> predicate)
        Evaluate the given predicate on, and possibly remove, each key-value mapping in this map. For each mapping in this map in an unspecified order, the given predicate's test() method is called, passing in a pair containing the key and the value. The state of the key must not be altered. The state of the value may be altered, and the value may be replaced by a different object; such changes are reflected in this map. If the test() method returns true, the mapping is removed from this map.

        Warning: If the predicate adds mappings to or removes mappings from the map, other than by returning true, the removeEachItemIf() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Parameters:
        predicate - Predicate.

      • forEachKeyDo

        public void forEachKeyDo(Action<K> action)
        Perform the given action on each key in this map. For each key in this map in an unspecified order, the given action's run() method is called, passing in the key. The state of the key must not be altered.

        Warning: If the action adds mappings to or removes mappings from the map, the forEachKeyDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Parameters:
        action - Action.

The state of the key must not be altered. After all the keys have been processed, the given action's result() method is called, and its result is returned.

For each key in this map in an unspecified order, the given predicate's test() method is called, passing in the key. The state of the key must not be altered. If the test() method returns true, the key and its associated value are removed from this map.

        Warning: If the predicate adds mappings to or removes mappings from the map, other than by returning true, the removeEachKeyIf() method's behavior is unspecified.

        predicate - Predicate.

      • toArray

        public Pair<K,V>[] toArray(Pair<K,V>[] array)
        Store this map's key-value mappings in the given array. The mappings are stored in an unspecified order. The first mapping is stored at index 0, the second mapping at index 1, and so on. The number of array elements stored is array.length. If this map contains fewer than array.length mappings, the remaining array elements are set to null.

        The toArray() method stores references to this map's mappings in the given array. The states of the keys stored in the array must not be altered. The states of the values stored in the array may be altered, and the values stored in the array may be replaced by different objects; such changes are reflected in this map.

        Parameters:
        array - Array in which to store mappings.
        Returns:
        The given array is returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if array is null.

      • toArray

        public Pair<K,V>[] toArray(Pair<K,V>[] array,
                  int off,
                  int len)
        Store this map's key-value mappings in a portion of the given array. The mappings are stored in an unspecified order. The first mapping is stored at index off, the second mapping at index off+1, and so on. The number of array elements stored is len. If this map contains fewer than len mappings, the remaining array elements are set to null.

        The toArray() method stores references to this map's mappings in the given array. The states of the keys stored in the array must not be altered. The states of the values stored in the array may be altered, and the values stored in the array may be replaced by different objects; such changes are reflected in this map.

        Parameters:
        array - Array in which to store mappings.
        off - Index at which to store first mapping.
        len - Number of mappings to store.
        Returns:
        The given array is returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if array is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > array.length.

      • keysToArray

        public K[] keysToArray(K[] array)
        Store this map's keys in the given array. The keys are stored in an unspecified order. The first key is stored at index 0, the second key at index 1, and so on. The number of array elements stored is array.length. If this map contains fewer than array.length mappings, the remaining array elements are set to null.

        The keysToArray() method stores references to this map's keys in the given array. The states of the keys stored in the array must not be altered.

        Parameters:
        array - Array in which to store keys.
        Returns:
        The given array is returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if array is null.

      • valuesToArray

        public V[] valuesToArray(V[] array)
        Store this map's values in the given array. The values are stored in an unspecified order. The first value is stored at index 0, the second value at index 1, and so on. The number of array elements stored is array.length. If this map contains fewer than array.length mappings, the remaining array elements are set to null.

        The valuesToArray() method stores references to this map's values in the given array. The states of the values stored in the array may be altered; such changes are reflected in this map.

      • getPair

        protected Pair<K,V> getPair(K key,
                V value)
        Create a pair containing the given key and value. Whenever class Map needs to create a pair, it does so by calling this method.

        The getPair() method in class Map returns an instance of class Pair<K,V>. The given key is copied using the copyKey() method. The given value is copied using the copyValue() method. A subclass of class Map can override the getPair() method to return something else. Possibilities include:

        • Return an instance of a subclass of class Pair<K,V>, in which the equals() and hashCode() methods have been overridden to implement a different pair equality criterion.

        • Return an instance of a subclass of class Pair<K,V>, in which the writeOut() and readIn() methods have been overridden to implement different streaming behavior.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        value - Value.
        Returns:
        Pair consisting of (key, value).

      • copyKey

        protected K copyKey(K key)
        Copy the given key. The copyKey() method in class Map merely returns the key reference; this makes a shallow copy. A subclass of class Map can override the copyKey() method to return something else. Possibilities include:

        • Return a clone of the key, which makes a deep copy.

        • Return an instance of a subclass of the key's class, in which the equals() and hashCode() methods have been overridden to implement a different key equality criterion.

        • Return an instance of a subclass of the key's class, in which the writeOut() and readIn() methods have been overridden to implement different streaming behavior.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to copy.
        Returns:
        Copy of key.

      • copyValue

        protected V copyValue(V value)
        Copy the given value. The copyValue() method in class Map merely returns the value reference; this makes a shallow copy. A subclass of class Map can override the copyValue() method to return something else. Possibilities include:

        • Return a clone of the value, which makes a deep copy.

        • Return an instance of a subclass of the value's class, in which the writeOut() and readIn() methods have been overridden to implement different streaming behavior.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to copy.
        Returns:
        Copy of value.
